newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on CBOT, crusher deliveries.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on CBOT, crusher deliveries.

text.p: WCE canola futures closed at or near session lows, weighed down by CBOT soycomplex weakness, technical selling and crusher deliveries in the September, traders said.
"CanAmera delivered dirty seed in Dixon (Sask). That's the first time a crusher's delivered on the new contract," a trader said. Sep-Nov spread $3, Nov-Jan $5, Nov-May $7.50. Volume was 6,600 lots.
Japan bought 5,000 to 6,000 tonnes overnight. Europe was said to have bought 60,000 tonnes in the past week and rumoured to be bidding for one more cargo load.
September canola futures lost $9.30 to $417.50, November fell $3.10 to $424.30.
LFG sold Oct peas down US$1 at US$209, Cargill sold Dec peas down US$1 to US$210, traders said. Volume was 35 lots.
LFG bought Oct and Dec oats with Cargill selling October down US$2 to US$136, traders said. Also, commission houses sold December down US$1.50 to US$138. Volume was 50 lots.
"There's short covering in feed grains on a high quality crop coming in with less feed than expected," a trader said.
October feed wheat rose $2.10 to $208.60 and December ended up $1.60 at $193.10 on commercial buying. Volume was 2,000. November barley rose $0.40 to $150.70, February up $0.50 to $155.70.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
